descript.abstract: The Component Geomorphic Description table lists the geomorphic features on which the referenced map unit component typically occurs.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: One of several pseudo-hierarchical terms used to describe relative levels of scale for geomorphic terms.
A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Component Geomorphic Description table.
A yes/no field that indicates if a particular geomorphic feature is representative for the component.
The unique identifier of a record in the Component table. Use this column to join the Component Geomorphic Description table to the Component table.
An integer referring to the Feature ID in another row in the same table, intended to indicate a relationship between two or more rows in a table.
A word or group of words used to name a feature on the earth's surface, expressed in the plural form.

A user specified term(s) used in association with geomorphic features to further define, clarify, and describe the setting of a soil in the the landscape. The terms may, for example, describe relative position, mode of formation, degree of degradation, slope, or geologic time of origin.
An integer number assigned by a user to identify a particular row in the table.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
